Subject: Reading
Details: Can begin to find the main idea and key details with teacher assistance.
Can begin to identify nonfiction text features.
Can begin to make connections from text to text, self and the world with teacher assistance.
Can begin to read their writing.
Can recognize simple words.
Continue reading books on RAZ Kids

Subject: Reading
Details: Can begin to find the main idea and key details.
Can begin to identify nonfiction text features.
Can begin to make connections from text to text, self and the world.
Can learn and share information from reading.
Can discuss characters and story events with guidance.
Practice reading English books at home
Continue reading books on RAZ Kids

Subject: Reading
Details: Can sometimes, or with assistance, find the main idea and key details.
Can sometimes, or with assistance, identify non-fiction text features.
Can sometimes, or with assistance, make various text connections.
Can begin to read aloud with fluency.
Continue reading books on RAZ Kids
Practice reading aloud with fluency

Subject: Reading
Details: Can mostly figure out what information is important.
Can mostly find the main idea and key details.
Can mostly identify non-fiction text features.
Can mostly make connections from text to text, self and the world.
Can choose reading materials at the appropriate level.
Practice reading English books at home
Practice reading aloud with expression

Subject: Reading
Details: Can find the main idea and key details.
Can identify nonfiction text features.
Can make connections from text to text, self and the world.
Can ask questions to help them understand what they are reading.
Can read aloud with fluency, expression, and confidence.
Stretch themselves by reading more complex books at home

Subject: Writing
Details: Can begin to differentiate writing for contexts and audiences with teacher assistance.
Can begin to identify basic components of a letter (date, greeting, body, closing, signature) with teacher assistance.
Can only use transition words and phrases to connect ideas with teacher support.
Can begin to use simple sentence structures and punctuation with teacher assistance.
Can begin to provide reasons and examples with teacher assistance.
Write sentences independently

Subject: Writing
Details: Can begin to differentiate writing for contexts and audiences.
Can begin to identify basic components of a letter (date, greeting, body, closing, signature).
Can only edit and revise some written pieces with teacher support.
Can begin to use simple sentence structures and punctuation.
Can begin to provide a reason to support an opinion.
Write a wider variety of sentences

Subject: Writing
Details: Can differentiate writing for some contexts and audiences with prompting.
Can identify basic components of a letter (date, greeting, body, closing, signature).
Can use simple sentence structures and punctuation.
Can sometimes edit and revise some written pieces.
Can sometimes use transition words and phrases to connect ideas smoothly and logically.
Can provide a reason to support an opinion, using evidence.
Continue writing to different audiences

Subject: Writing
Details: Can differentiate writing for some contexts and audiences.
Can identify basic components of a letter (date, greeting, body, closing, signature).
Can use complex sentence structures and punctuation.
Can independently edit and revise some written pieces.
Can use transition words and phrases to connect ideas smoothly and logically.
Can provide multiple reasons to support an opinion, using basic evidence.
Give more examples and evidence to support reasons

Subject: Writing
Details: Can differentiate writing for varying contexts and audiences (formal and informal).
Can identify basic components of a letter (date, greeting, body, closing, signature).
Can use complex sentence structures and punctuation.
Can independently edit and revise writing.
Can use a variety of transition words and phrases to connect ideas smoothly and logically.
Can provide multiple reasons to support an opinion, using lots of evidence.
Continue writing to different audiences

Subject: Speaking
Details: Can begin to use basic English in social situations.
Can respond to greetings with short phrases.
Can respond to simple questions with more than one-word answers.
Can participate orally in very basic classroom discussions with guidance.
Can express basic needs or conditions.
Listen to as much English content as possible

Subject: Speaking
Details: Can use English in social situations.
Can begin to respond to more complex questions.
Can express needs and give basic information independently.
Can ask simple, everyday questions.
Practice sharing basic social information with peers
Listen to as much English content as possible

Subject: Speaking
Details: Can respond to more complex questions independently.
Can ask questions to clarify content and meaning.
Can begin to speak with confidence in front of a group.
Can answer simple content-based questions.
Can retell short stories or events.
Can orally engage in problem-solving.
Practice answering simple questions
Practice retelling short stories or events

Subject: Speaking
Details: Can show confidence when speaking in front of a group.
Can communicate well in a majority of subject areas.
Can answer opinion questions with supporting details.
Can discuss stories, issues, and concepts.
Can give content-based oral reports.
Can offer creative solutions to issues/problems.
Practice answering opinion questions with supporting details
Practice discussing stories

Subject: Speaking
Details: Can participate and communicate competently in all subject areas.
Can speak English with near-native fluency; any hesitation does not interfere with communication.
Can vary speech appropriately using intonation and stress independently.
Can ask questions to develop ideas and extend understanding.

Subject: Listening
Details: Can follow one-step oral directions.
Can identify objects, figures, people from oral statements or questions.
Can match classroom oral language to daily routines.
Practice demonstrating appropriate attentive listening behaviours without constant teacher prompting

Subject: Listening
Details: Can follow two- to three-step oral directions.
Can evaluate oral information.
Can identify more objects, figures, people from oral statements or questions.
Can demonstrate appropriate attentive listening behaviours only with significant teacher prompting.
Practice demonstrating appropriate attentive listening behaviours

Subject: Listening
Details: Can follow multi-step oral directions occasionally with help.
Can sometimes identify key information in announcements and instructions.
Can demonstrate appropriate attentive listening behaviours with some teacher prompting.
Follow directions and instructions quickly without teacher needing to repeat them
Use attentive listening behaviors at all times

Subject: Listening
Details: Can interpret oral information and apply it to situations.
Can follow multi-step oral directions.
Can demonstrate appropriate attentive listening behaviours with minimal teacher prompting.
Follow directions and instructions quickly without teacher needing to repeat them
Practice demonstrating appropriate attentive listening behaviours at all times

Subject: Listening
Details: Can carry out oral instructions containing grade level, content-based language.
Can demonstrate appropriate attentive listening behaviors independently.
Can follow multi-step oral directions.
Follow directions and instructions quickly without teacher needing to repeat them

Subject: Use of English
Details: Can begin to use an increasing range of present simple forms with teacher assistance.
Can begin to use past simple forms to describe routines, habits and states with teacher assistance.
Work hard at learning the grammar formulas and studying for the vocabulary and grammar tests
Remember to use capital letters and correct punctuation

Subject: Use of English
Details: Can begin to correctly use an increasing range of present simple forms to describe routines, habits and states.
Can begin to correctly use an increasing range of past simple forms to describe routines, habits and states.
Work hard at learning the grammar formulas and studying for the vocabulary and grammar tests
Remember to use capital letters and correct punctuation

Subject: Use of English
Details: Can sometimes, or with assistance, correctly use an increasing range of present simple forms.
Can sometimes, or with assistance, correctly use an increasing range of past simple forms.
Work hard at learning the grammar formulas and studying for the vocabulary and grammar tests
Do the Vocabulary and Grammar Kahoots as practice before the tests

Subject: Use of English
Details: Can correctly use an increasing range of present simple forms.
Can correctly use the present continuous.
Can correctly use an increasing range of past simple forms.
Can correctly use present perfect forms to express what has happened with for and since.
Start using their grammar points in their writing

Subject: Use of English
Details: Can correctly use an increasing range of present simple forms.
Can correctly use the present continuous.
Can correctly use an increasing range of past simple forms.
Can correctly use present perfect forms to express what has happened with for and since.
Start using their grammar points in their writing
